moves.2. g3: !? This is an inaccuracy. e4 was best.
moves.8. Bg5: I threaten to trade of one of the defenders of d5.
moves.12... exd4 13. cxd4 Bc4: This bishop becomes a headache throughout the whole game.
moves.14. d5 Nb4 15. a3: Go ahead. Chat, Lake-bay that move was horrendous.
moves.15... Bxb2 16. Rb1 Bxa3: I overlooked that. It pays to use the 'analyze the board' window!
moves.17. Nd2: I try to generate a counterattack since the bishop isn't going anywhere.
moves.17... Bd3: ! This sets a trap I fell hard for!
moves.18... Qa5: ?? Returning the favor! Bc2!! was correct.
moves.19. Nb1: ? I am not learning from past failures.
moves.20. Rxa3: I have the last laugh. We now have a massive material swap.
moves.20... Bxd1 21. Rxa5 Bxe2 22. Re1 Bd3: An even trade. I am still down two pawns.
moves.25. Rxe5 Rfe8 26. f4: I decide to exchange on my own grounds.
moves.27. fxe5: I have two powerful central pawns.
moves.28... Bf5: The only move. Anything else allows the pawn to queen.
moves.29. Nd5: I thought I was winning now.
moves.32. Kf2 Rd1 33. Rxa6 c4 34. Bxb5: I groan when I see this. Ra3! was correct.
moves.40. Kf3 f5: At the time I thought this was a mistake. This is actually quite strong.
moves.43. Kd4 Ke6 44. Rh3: I saw my planned Kc4 would be punished by Bb5+!
moves.49... f3 50. h5 f2 51. hxg6: I debated Rxg6 but that fails too. At this point he chatted 'make sure to annotate my victory!' 'No problem, I'll blow out of proportion how Big Bertha was killed!' I replied.
moves.51... f1=Q 52. g7 Qf2+ 53. Kd3: All else gets me a fork between K&R
moves.53... Rxh6 54. g8=Q: Now time to live up to my promise. I will kill Big Bertha!
moves.54... Rh3+ 55. Kc4 Qf4#: How sad. Big Bertha lived to tell the tale.
